data.title: Jonah Hill asks fans to not comment on his body: It doesnâ€™t feel good
data.meta_description: Actor Jonah Hill â€” whose weight gains and losses have made headlines over the years â€” wants the public to stop focusing on his physique.
data.text:
Actor Jonah Hill â€” whose weight gains and losses have made headlines over the years â€” wants the public to stop focusing on his physique.

â€œI know you mean well but I kindly ask that you not comment on my body â¤ï¸ï¸â€ the â€œSuperbadâ€ star wrote on Instagram Wednesday.

â€œGood or bad I want to politely let you know itâ€™s not helpful and doesnâ€™t feel good. Much respect.â€

The 37-year-oldâ€™s sister, â€œImpeachmentâ€ star Beanie Feldstein, praised him for his remark, writing, â€œTHATS ğŸ‘ MY ğŸ‘ BROTHER ğŸ‘.â€

Plus-size model Tess Holliday added, â€œLOUDER ğŸ—£ğŸ—£ğŸ—£ğŸ—£â€ and â€œTHIS ğŸ’¯ğŸ’¯ğŸ’¯ğŸ’¯ğŸ’¯.â€

However, one star, in particular, appeared to miss the mark with her comment: Sharon Stone.

The â€œBasic Instinctâ€ star, 63, wrote under Hillâ€™s post, â€œCan I say you look good cuz you do ğŸ”¥.â€

â€œJesus Sharon read the room!â€ one person wrote back.

Another added, â€œSharon is the new Karen ğŸ™„.â€

It is unclear if there was a specific photo or comment that prompted Hill, 37, to make his request, but his weight has certainly fueled water cooler gossip as it has yo-yoed for acting roles over the years.

Following his 2013 hit â€œWolf of Wall Street,â€ he packed on the pounds for his role in â€œWar Dogs,â€ but then slimmed down by the summer of 2016.

He then lost even more weight in 2017 for his Netflix series, â€œManiac,â€ sparking more chatter from the public at the time.

However, in contrast to his post on Wednesday, Hill previously seemed more open to sharing his struggles with body image in the past.

In February, after news outlets posted shirtless photos of him surfing in Malibu, the â€œSuperbadâ€ star shared on social media, â€œI donâ€™t think I ever took my shirt off in a pool until I was in my mid 30s even in front of family and friends.

â€œProbably would have happened sooner if my childhood insecurities werenâ€™t exacerbated by years of public mockery about my body by press and interviewers,â€ he added. â€œIâ€™m 37 and finally love and accept myself.â€

However, Hill also explained at the time a similar sentiment to what he posted on Instagram Wednesday, sharing that he didnâ€™t want negative or positive feedback.

â€œThis isnâ€™t a â€˜good for meâ€™ post. And itâ€™s definitely not a â€˜feel bad for me post,'â€ he said. â€œItâ€™s for the kids who donâ€™t take their shirt off at the pool. Have fun. Youâ€™re wonderful and awesome and perfect. All my love.â€

Since finally getting to a place of self-love and self-acceptance, Hill also found love in someone else: his girlfriend, Sarah Brady.
